radiographic_examinations.findings: In the right lung base a pleural based nodule measures 3 mm; otherwise, the lung bases are clear. The liver enhances homogeneously without focal lesions. The gallbladder is normal. The pancreas, spleen and adrenal glands appear normal. Bilateral, right greater than left, renal polar areas of hypoattenuation and cortical thinning are identified. No evidence of hydronephrosis. A dilated fluid-filled structure measuring 9 mm in diameter with hyperenhancing mucosa represents an inflamed appendix with surrounding fat stranding. No evidence of free air or adjacent fluid collections to indicate rupture. The bladder is filled and appears normal. The uterus and adnexa are unremarkable. Prominent mesenteric lymphadenopathy likely reactive.
